'Williamsburg' is a neighborhood in the New York City borough of Brooklyn,
bordering Greenpoint to the North, BedfordâStuyvesant to the South, Bushwick and
Ridgewood, Queens to the East and the East River to the West. The neighborhood
is part of Brooklyn Community Board 1. The neighborhood is served by the New
York Police Department (NYPD)'s
90th [http://www.nyc.gov/html/nypd/html/precincts/precinct_090.shtml 90th
Precinct], NYPD. Precinct. In the City Council the western and southern
part of the neighborhood is represented by the 33rd District; and the eastern
part of the neighborhood is represented by the 34th
District.

Williamsburg is an influential hub for indie rock, hipster culture, and the
local art community. Many ethnic groups also have enclaves within Williamsburg,
including Italians, Jewish People, Puerto Ricans, and Dominicans. The
neighborhood is being redefined by a growing population and the rapid
development of housing and retail space particularly catered to a wealthy
population that has been historically foreign to the neighborhood.
